result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwayne D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Restitution set at $0(ZERO).

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 1/2 years initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Betty T. and her residence.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification, signed and filed by the Court.  The defendant's request for sentence modification is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc
Letter from defendant (pro se) requesting court to modify eligibility waiting period.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing AUGUST 20, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Dwayne D Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dwayne D Davis in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Betty T. and her residence.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (Zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 1/2 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Dwayne D Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dwayne D Davis in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, THURSDAY JULY 09, 2015 AT 8:30 A.M. IN BR 26, CH RM 634. kl

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Dwayne D Davis not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Dwayne D Davis not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Dwayne D Davis not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant may qualify for drug treatment court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, Defendant Dwayne D Davis not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Dwayne D Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dwayne D Davis in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Betty T

Defendant Dwayne D Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Dwayne D Davis in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
